conversation.message: Hello School_A Admissions, I’m Student_B. School_A is my first choice because I’m looking for a rigorous academic environment and I’m excited about contributing to campus life. I would be honored to join if offered a seat and would accept promptly. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_A, but School_A ranks me 4th and capacity is 1, so my acceptance chance there is low if higher-priority students apply. School_C ranks me 1st, making it a very strong safety where I can likely secure a match. However, since this is round 1, I should first try for my highest true preference (School_A) with a direct application, because if accepted it maximizes my outcome; if rejected, I can pivot quickly to School_C in the next round.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_B,

Thank you for your application and for sharing why School_A is your first choice. After reviewing applications in this round and given our limited capacity, we’re not able to offer you a seat at this time.

We appreciate your interest in School_A and wish you the very best in the matching process.

Sincerely,
School_A Admissions
conversation.thought: School_A has quota 1 and true priority ranks Student_E above Student_B. In this round, both Student_B and Student_E applied. Since Student_E is School_A's top priority and also expressed willingness to commit, accepting Student_B now would block matching with a higher-priority student. Therefore, reject Student_B to preserve the seat for Student_E.

conversation.message: Dear School_A admissions, I’m Student_E. I’m very interested in joining School_A and believe I would be a strong fit for your program and community. If admitted, I’m ready to commit and contribute fully. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_C, but School_C’s priority ranks me 4th (behind B, C, D). If I apply there now, I’m likely to be rejected if higher-priority students apply. School_A is my 3rd choice, but crucially School_A ranks me 1st overall, so an early application should secure an immediate match at a relatively high-ranked option. Locking in School_A now avoids the risk of ending up with a much worse outcome later.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_A. We are pleased to offer you admission to School_A. We believe you would be a great fit for our community, and we look forward to the contributions you’ll bring.

Sincerely,
School_A Admissions
conversation.thought: Student_E is School_A’s top priority on the true priority list. We have quota 1 and have received applications from Student_B and Student_E this round. Although Student_B ranks School_A first, Student_E is strictly higher in our priorities, and accepting Student_E immediately secures our best possible match. Student_E also ranks School_A third, but their message indicates readiness to commit if admitted, so accepting now is optimal and fills our single seat.

conversation.message: Hello School_B admissions committee—School_B is my first-choice school. I’m very motivated to join your community and would enthusiastically accept an offer. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, so I should apply immediately. Although School_B ranks me last in its priority list, delaying would only reduce my chances further since other students (especially Student_B and Student_C) may also pursue it and are ranked above me. An early, clear application is the best attempt to secure my first choice before it fills.

conversation.message: Thank you for your application and for naming School_B as your first choice. After reviewing our current applicant pool for this round, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time. We appreciate your interest and wish you the best in the process.
conversation.thought: Student_A is lowest on School_B’s true priority list (E > B > C > D > A). In this round, Student_C and Student_D—both ranked higher than Student_A—have applied to School_B and claim first-choice commitment. With quota 1, accepting Student_A now would likely block a better-ranked match (especially C or D). Given full information, Student_E and Student_B are higher but are not currently in my inbox; however, I can still improve over A immediately by choosing among current applicants. Therefore I should reject Student_A to preserve capacity for a higher-priority student.

conversation.message: School_B is my first-choice school. I’m applying because I’m highly motivated to join your program and would commit if accepted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, so I should apply immediately. I have relatively strong priority at School_B (they rank me 3rd after Student_E and Student_B). Since capacity is 1, competition will be intense, but applying now maximizes my chance to secure my first choice before they commit to someone else.

conversation.message: Thank you for your application and for naming School_B as your first choice. We’re pleased to offer you admission to School_B, and we look forward to welcoming you to our incoming class.
conversation.thought: As School_B, my true priority is E > B > C > D > A. In this round I have applications from A, C, and D; among them, C is the highest on my list. However, I have only 1 seat and Student_E (my top choice) has not applied yet; Student_E’s preferences place School_B last, so they are unlikely to apply, but could if rejected elsewhere. Student_B (my #2) prefers School_A first and may apply to me later if not accepted there. If I accept C now, I forgo any chance to take B later; but given C is applying now and is my #3, and there is no way to hold/wait under the rules (must accept or reject on APPLY), accepting C secures a high-priority match rather than risking ending up with D/A or unfilled. Therefore accept Student_C.

conversation.message: Dear School_B admissions team, I’m Student_D and I’m formally applying. School_B is my first-choice school, and if accepted I will commit to enrolling. I’m excited by the academic environment and would be grateful for the opportunity to join your incoming class.
